intro: Echinopsilon sedoides f. tauricus, commonly known as the Tauric sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiniaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with dense clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in harsh conditions. This subspecies is native to southern regions of the Caucasus and parts of Turkey.
